User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user profile within the Spotly application, mirroring the structure stored in Firestore.

walletAddress.description: The Solana wallet address of the user, used as the unique identifier (document ID) in Firestore and the Firebase Auth uid.

username.description: The user's display name or username.

role.description: The user's role within the application ('regular', 'fan', 'artist', 'business').

bio.description: A short biography or description of the user.

profilePhotoUrl.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

bannerPhotoUrl.description: URL of the user's banner photo.

socialLinks.description: JSON string containing links to the user's social media profiles.

extraLinks.description: JSON string containing additional links provided by the user.

skills.description: A comma-separated list of the user's skills.

tags.description: A comma-separated list of tags associated with the user.

rankingScore.description: A score representing the user's ranking on the platform.

isBanned.description: Indicates whether the user is banned from the platform.

isSuspended.description: Indicates whether the user's account is suspended.

suspensionReason.description: The reason for the user's suspension.

warnings.description: The number of warnings the user has received.

adminNotes.description: Notes added by administrators regarding the user.

isDeleted.description: Indicates whether the user's account is marked as deleted.

talentCategory.description: The primary talent category of the user (e.g., 'music', 'acting', 'creator').

talentSubcategories.description: JSON string containing an array of subcategories related to the user's talent.

subRole.description: A more specific role or sub-role of the user (e.g., 'singer', 'actor').

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user's profile was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user's profile was last updated.

Video.title: Video
Video.description: Represents a video uploaded by an artist.

artistId.description: The wallet address of the artist (Firebase Auth UID).

duration.description: The duration of the video in seconds.

isBanned.description: Indicates if the video is banned.

bookCount.description: Number of times the artist was booked from this video.

commentCount.description: The number of comments on the video.

shareCount.description: The number of times the video has been shared.

adoptCount.description: Number of times this video was adopted.

rankingScore.description: Score used for ranking the video.

rawVideoInput.description: Original user-provided URL for the video.

hiddenFromFeed.description: Whether the video is hidden from the main feed.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the video was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the video was last updated.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. The 'walletAddress' serves as both the document ID and the Firebase Auth UID (Solana public key), ensuring direct ownership and simplifying security rules. Includes all user profile data as defined in the provided schema.

params.name: walletAddress
params.description: The Solana wallet address of the user, functioning as the document ID and Firebase Auth UID.

definition.description: Stores video data. Each document is a unique video.

params.name: videoId
params.description: The auto-generated ID for the video document.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure is designed to manage user authentication, profiles and videos using Firebase, focusing on replacing the existing Devbase user management system with Firebase Auth and Firestore. It prioritizes Authorization Independence by avoiding hierarchical `get()` calls in security rules. The `users` collection stores user profiles, with the document ID matching the Firebase Auth `uid` (Solana wallet address), ensuring direct access and simplifying security rules based on user ownership. The `videos` collection stores all video data, with `artistId` linking back to a user. All data in `users` and `videos` collections have the same security requirements. The structure enables secure `list` operations (QAPs) by storing user and video data directly in their respective collections, avoiding the need to filter based on parent document data.  Specifically, this structure avoids hierarchical dependencies, enabling atomic operations. Roles are stored directly in the database (DBAC), relying solely on `request.auth.uid` for authorization.
